meanings.sent1: She spent hours scouring the pots and pans until they sparkled.
meanings.sent2: I will be scouring the bathtub later to remove all the soap scum.
meanings.sent3: After scouring the kitchen floor, she realized she had been using the wrong cleaning solution.
meanings.sent4: The detective was scouring the crime scene for any clues that could lead to the suspect.
meanings.sent5: The old man's eyes were scouring the horizon for any sign of the approaching storm.

meanings.definition: Search through (a place or thing) thoroughly in order to find something.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist was scouring the desert for ancient artifacts.
meanings.sent2: I will be scouring my room for the missing keys.
meanings.sent3: She was scouring the library for a book that would help her with her research.
meanings.sent4: The journalist was scouring through old newspapers to find information for the article.
meanings.sent5: The kids were scouring the park for hidden Easter eggs.
